channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Students and recent grads! Last call for a Student Pass discount at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 is only two weeks away, and we want to ensure that students and recent grads don’t miss out on the full Attendee Pass experien...

item.title: We Tried the World’s Most Expensive Wireless Speakers.
item.description: You could drop $40,000 on 200 Sonos speakers, or get a single pair of Focal's Utopia Diva. In this case, less is most definitely more.

item.title: How Should We Feel About Ring?
item.description: Amazon's popular security camera brand now has some AI enhancements that make it easier to sort through footage. But we have to ask: Is more AI-powere...

item.title: Opera’s new feature lets you group, pin and close tabs through natural language commands
item.description: Opera browser has a new AI-powered feature that lets you take action on tabs through natural language queries. Things you can do include grouping, pin...

item.title: The Polymarket Bubble: Everyone Is Betting on the US Election
item.description: Election betting is big, and people across the aisle are all in.

item.title: Psychedelic Mushrooms Are Getting Much, Much Stronger
item.description: Cultivators are turning to genetic sequencing and cellular-manipulation techniques to breed highly potent mushrooms—leaving some unprepared psychonaut...

item.title: Someone claims to have used AI to apply to 2,843 jobs
item.description: AI is spamming up job applications. 404 Media’s Jason Koebler writes about a person who claimed to have used a free tool, AI Hawk, to apply for 17 job...

item.title: Scope3 starts tracking the carbon footprint of AI
item.description: The startup, which already monitors the climate impact of digital advertising, is expanding to include artificial intelligence. © 2024 TechCrunch. All...

item.title: The World's First Commercial Space Station Looks Like a Luxury Hotel Inside

item.title: Relyance lands $32M to help companies comply with data regulations
